channel.title: gRPC issues when creating a service
channel.description:
`npm link` does not work
Error:
`Error: The gRPC binary module was not installed. This may be fixed by running "npm rebuild" Original error: Cannot find module '/usr/lib/node_modules/@mesg/cli/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/node-v64-linux-x64-glibc/grpc_node.node' at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/lib/node_modules/@mesg/cli/node_modules/grpc/src/grpc_extension.js:43:17) at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/lib/node_modules/@mesg/cli/node_modules/grpc/src/client_interceptors.js:144:12) `

item.title: gRPC issues when creating a service
item.dc:creator: fragment
item.description:
Sure! The error pops up on *NIX 18.04 Ubuntu LTS and Windows via Powershell. It shows this:

Read full topic
item.source: gRPC issues when creating a service

item.title: gRPC issues when creating a service
item.dc:creator: Nicolas
item.description:
Hi,

why are you trying the use npm link?

To install the CLI, you should run npm install -g @mesg/cli
To install the service lib in a service: npm install @mesg/service

Could you show the whole output with the command you use and the OS you are running.

Read full topic
item.source: gRPC issues when creating a service
